2:
"How you have helped one who has no power!
\q How you have saved the arm that has no strength!
\q
3:
How you have advised one who has no wisdom
\q and announced to him sound knowledge!
\q
4:
With whose help have you spoken these words?
\q Whose spirit was it that came out from you?
5:
The dead are made to tremble,
\q those who are beneath the waters
\q and all who dwell in them.
\q
6:
Sheol is naked before God;
\q destruction itself has no covering against him.
7:
He stretches out the northern skies 
\q over the empty space,
\q and he hangs the earth over nothing.
\q
8:
He binds up the waters in his thick clouds,
\q but the clouds are not torn under them.
9:
He covers the surface of the moon
\q and spreads his clouds on it.
\q
10:
He has engraved a circular boundary on the surface of the waters
\q as the line between light and darkness.
11:
The pillars of heaven tremble
\q and are astonished at his rebuke.
\q
12:
He calmed the sea with his power;
\q by his understanding he shattered Rahab.
